name: Number Hunt From One to Ten Quiz | Wordplay for Kids | 10 Questions

questions.text: If our friends like something, we usually like it, too.
questions.explanation:
four.

	IF OUR friends like something, we usually like it, too. Four quarters equal one dollar. Four cups equal one quart.

questions.text: Just listen to him neigh, that horse!
questions.explanation:
eight & ten.

	Just lisTEN to him nEIGH, That horse! August is the eighth month, but long ago, October was. The word part OCT means eight, as in octagon (an eight-sided shape).

questions.text: That wonderful day was over too soon!
questions.explanation:
two.

	ThaT WOnderful day was over too soon! Expressions and sayings with "two" include: It takes two to tango. Two's company, three's a crowd. Tea for two. A bicycle built for two.

nine.

	JeNI NEver eats tomatoes. There are eight planets plus one dwarf planet in our solar system, making nine in total. Can you name them? They begin with these letters: M, V, E, M, J, S, U, N, and P.

questions.text: They made woven baskets with reeds from the lake.
questions.explanation:
three.

	They made woven baskets wiTH REEds from the lake. The number three is popular in fairy tales and folktales. There's the three bears, the three little pigs, and the three billy goats gruff. There are many fairytale families with three daughters or three sons. Usually the youngest is the hero or heroine.

questions.text: Pablo's even bigger than I am.
questions.explanation:
seven.

	Pablo'S EVEN bigger than I am. There are seven days in a week, and some people consider seven a lucky number.

questions.text: Taking juice from the fridge, Steffi very carefully filled the glass.
questions.explanation:
five.

	Taking juice from the fridge, StefFI VEry carefully filled the glass. Our number system is based on ten because we have five fingers on each hand.

questions.text: Arriving with a wrapped gift, Uncle Brent entered and greeted us.
questions.explanation:
ten.

	Arriving with a wrapped gift, Uncle BrenT ENtered and greeted us. The number one million equals 10 times 10 (100) times 10 (1,000) times 10 (10,000) times 10 (100,000) times 10 (1,000,000).

questions.text: Don't serve broccoli, because Laura and Leo never eat it.
questions.explanation:
one.

	Don't serve broccoli, because Laura and LeO NEver eat it. All for one and one for all. There's a song called "One is the Loneliest Number." Do you agree?

questions.text: Dr. Ursula Boynton, whose nickname is Ursi, x-rays people's bones to see whether they're broken.
questions.explanation:
six & one.

	Dr. Ursula Boynton, whose nickname is UrSI, X-rays people's bONEs to see whether they're broken. Dr. Boynton is my stepsister Ursi, who married Mario Carrasco in Santiago, Chile, on April 24, 2004. Thanks for taking the quiz, and thanks to minch and Quizwhizz for the idea!
